model.BoardPack

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.BoardPack.Rule

  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    Processing of operations related to the current rule set. The class extracts the values which should be used for the birth rule and the survival rule, assigns the numeric value(s) for the birth rule to the int[] birthArray and the numeric value(s) for the survival rule to the int[] surviveArray. The birthArray and the surviveArray is further used to determine the new cell state for a cell by using the number of neighbors and the current cell state.

      • toIntArray

public static int[] toIntArray(java.lang.String rule)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert a String to an int[] for later use in rleRules.
        Parameters:

      • rleRules

        public static byte rleRules(int cellState,
                            int numNeighbours)
        Tests the cell with its cellState with the corresponding number of neighbors, numNeighbours. The return value is either 0 or 1, determined by the four variables cellState, numNeighbours, birthArray and surviveArray. Example of usage: B36/S23 (B for birth and S for survival). If a dead cell(0) has 3 or 6 neighbors: turns alive (0 becomes 1). If not 3 or 6: still a dead cell (0). If an alive cell has 2 or 3 neighbors: still alive (1). If not 2 or 3: the alive cell dies (1 becomes 0).
        Parameters:
        cellState - the state of the current cell (0 or 1)
        numNeighbours - the number of neighbors of the current cell [0, 8]
        Returns:
        return the new cell state (0 or 1)

      • setRuleString

        public static void setRuleString(java.lang.String aRuleString)
        Setting a new ruleString. The String represents a rule set on the form "Bx/Sx" or "s/b" which is used to extract the variables representing the rules.
        Parameters:
        aRuleString - the ruleString to set

      • setRules

        public static void setRules(java.lang.String bValue,
                            java.lang.String sValue)
        Sets the birth variable and the survive variable from their respective Strings, bValue and sValue respectively. This method places the integer values of parameters into the respective int[] for further usage.
        Parameters:
        bValue - the birth rule (the number of neighbors needed for a 0 to 1 transition)
        sValue - the survival rule (the number of neighbors needed for 1 to 1 transition)

      • getBirthArray

        public static int[] getBirthArray()
        Gets the birthArray. The birthArray is assigned values in method setRules.
        Returns:
        birthArray the int[] containing the birth rules

      • getSurviveArray

        public static int[] getSurviveArray()
        Gets the surviveArray. The surviveArray is assigned values in method setRules.
        Returns:
        birthArray the int[] containing the survival rules
